irisslowlife: @reedamberx je t'aime! You are so inspiring by sharing the truth and fighting silly standards! I am skinny but I have one of a freaking loath after eating some food ahahah Therefore, eating less carbs and more raw food, and fermented has changed a lot for my dear intestines!

turtletturtle14: You make me feel so positive about my self thank you 🖤
addisonjudith: I have had chronic fatigue, fibromyalgia and IBS (plus some other nasty under-diagnosis pancreatic problems) pretty much my entire life but they really came into play when I was 16 and entering what should have been my “carefree, fun and partying” years but I found that every time I drank, ate out with friends or stayed up late I would wake up with searing pain and bloating that lasted days on end. My largest triggers are alcohol, a shit nights sleep, complex carbs, oils/fats (fried foods) and cheeses. I’ve learned that a hot shower goes the longest way, drinking an absolute metric fuck ton of water, vitamin B12 and most importantly letting myself take a BREAK - nap if you need to! Skip a meal if you’re in pain (just don’t skip every meal). Don’t feel pressured to do things that you know will put you down for a few days in pain just because “everyone else is doing it”. It’s okay to be kind to your body, and no one will judge you if you opt out of an activity because you are *literally* in pain, just tell them what’s up. This turned into a long comment but basically - make a list of what you eat and connect the dots of your triggers. Then REST REST REST and repeat to let your body recharge. 💙💕

minniequinn_x: I get super bloated and have a rock hard tummy after I eat white bread, beige foods (oven chips) and anything with a high saturate fat content. lydiakoifishy: 🥺😭 I love her so much! THANK YOU
hana.denton: I used to look 6months whenever I ate ANYTHING, to the point where a regular customer once saw me after lunch and came back with a giftbag of new baby clothes and a congratulations (🤮) card because she thought I was pregnant. Since i stopped eating dairy i rarely bloat to the extent I used to, im no longer in agony with the bloats I do get, and I usually only bloat now if I'm on my period or I eat until i feel sick 😅 people always used to make me feel shit when I bloated though because im a tall size 6 they'd say "oh well you wouldn't bloat if you actually ate" or "you can only see it because youre so skinny", which just caused me to have massive issues with food and eating, and gave me awful body dysmorphia. Now I'm a little older and a little more in tune with my body I realise that sometimes I bloat at certain times of the month because I'm a womxn, and sometimes I just bloat because I'm human, and its got fuck all to do with anyone else 🤗
